modules.description: Provides functions for manipulating lists and strings, including filtering, mapping, and concatenation. Works with native OCaml types such as lists, strings, and option values. Enables efficient text processing and data transformation in command-line tooling and script-like workflows.

Provides operations to convert a Ctypes node pointer into a structured representation, skip a node in a sequence, and serialize the structure to a string. Works with custom types representing shell syntax elements such as assignments, redirections, arguments, and line numbers. Used to parse and manipulate command-line syntax trees in a shell parser implementation.

The module provides low-level operations for managing C-compatible data structures and abstract syntax trees (ASTs), including memory management, field access, and traversal of nodes representing shell commands, conditionals, loops, and file operations. It works with C-like structs, AST elements, and pointer-based data, enabling tasks such as parsing shell syntax, inspecting command hierarchies, and handling file descriptors through direct manipulation of structured data. Specific use cases involve interfacing with C code, analyzing parsed command structures, and performing string and pointer operations for program state management.
